summary: the only approved therapy, interferon and ribavirin, has limited efficacy. there is an international effort to develop new antiviral agents and vaccines that are effective across all major HCV genotypes. recent trials show a rapid appearance of drug-resistant viruses. anti-CD81 monoclonal antibodies (MAbs) can inhibit HCV infection at late times after virus internalization. there is limited evidence for tight-junction protein association with HCV. this may reflect an indirect role for these proteins in the virus internalization process.
